Bio:
I am ambitious, hard-working and enthusiastic. With a strong work ethic, I thrive in high-pressure environments, consistently delivering high quality results. I am a constructive team member with experience managing teams, yet I also work effectively alone when needed. I take pride in delivering all tasks on time and to the highest possible standard.

My programming abilities span various paradigms and multiple languages, including JavaScript/TypeScript, Python, C/C++, C#, Java and Haskell. My proficiency in these languages allows me to pick up new languages quickly.

The University of Edinburgh — 2021-2025.summary: I am currently studying in my final year for Undergraduate Computer Science, and I am on track to receive a 1\textsuperscript{st} class honours degree.

Experience.Bar Tender — [The Three Tuns](https://ww: As a bar tender, I am responsible for serving customers, restocking, and ensuring the bar is kept clean and tidy. This role has allowed me to develop excellent communication and customer service skills.
Experience.Work Experience — [ARM Holdings](https:/: During my time at ARM, I was shown how ARM operates on a day-to-day basis, giving me a good sense of how leading companies work.
Experience.Work Experience — [Bit Solutions](https:: During my week at Bit Solutions, I experienced what it is like to work in the IT management sector, visiting clients' sites, and learning how to setup and manage various systems for those clients.

Volunteering.University Pool Society Secretary — 2024: As secretary, I play a large role in the organisation of events, and the overall running of the pool society.
Volunteering.Interact President — Member 2014-2021 —: Interact is a long-running fundraising organisation at [The Bishop's Stortford High School](https://tbshs.org), working closely with the [Rotary Club of Bishop's Stortford](http://bsrotary.org) to organise events and campaigns, raising money for local, national and global charities. My role as president entailed chairing our weekly meetings, and overseeing the organisation and running of events.
Volunteering.Senior Prefect — 2020-2021: As a senior prefect, I was responsible for assisting the school's Sixth Form Management Team throughout the year, and representing the school in various events such as open evenings.
Volunteering.Paired Numeracy — 2021: This involved weekly tutoring of younger students to help develop their maths skills at [The Bishop's Stortford High School](https://tbshs.org).
Volunteering.School Librarian — Member 2014-2019 — Co: My role involved the management of other Library Helpers to ensure the smooth running of the system, as well as weekly meetings to discuss how things went that week, and any plans for the next week.

Skills.Programming & Problem Solving: I can identify and solve problems quickly and efficiently and am a proficient programmer with knowledge of multiple languages including TypeScript, Java, C#, Haskell, PHP, C++, Python and more.
Skills.Numeracy: With an A* grade in A-Level Maths, a B grade in A-Level Further Maths, and with further study in Maths being essential to my chosen degree, I am highly skilled in Mathematics.
Skills.Public Speaking: I am perfectly capable of public speaking should the occasion arise. I was selected to speak in school church services every year, including Christmas and Easter services, as well as the [memorial service for a former headmaster](https://tbshs.org/ian-shaw-tbshs-1980-1998/).
Skills.Time Management: My excellent time management skills allow me to complete tasks to high standards while meeting all deadlines, as well as being able to juggle multiple tasks at once.
Skills.Teamwork: As a volunteer in the school library for 5 years and an integral part of [Interact](https://www.rotary.org/en/get-involved/interact-clubs) for 7, I developed strong teamwork skills, which were further developed during serveral group projects at university.
Skills.Customer Service: I have experience in customer service from my time as a bar tender, and have developed excellent communication skills as a result.
